summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: From: Paul—an apostle not sent from men or by a man, but by Jesus the Messiah, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and all the brothers who are with me.
To: The churches in Galatia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be yours!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave himself for our sins in order to rescue us from this present evil age according to the will of our God and Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him be the glory forever and ever! Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you by the grace of the Messiah and, instead, are following a different gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not that another one really exists. To be sure, there are certain people who are troubling you and want to distort the gospel about the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if we or an angel from heaven should proclaim to you a gospel contrary to what we proclaimed to you, let that person be condemned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What we have told you in the past I am now telling you again: If anyone proclaims to you a gospel contrary to what you received, let that person be condemned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I now trying to win the approval of people or of God? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be the Messiah’s servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I want you to know, brothers, that the gospel that was proclaimed by me is not of human origin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I did not receive it from a man, nor was I taught it, but it was revealed to me by Jesus the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have heard about my earlier life in Judaism—how I kept violently persecuting God’s church and was trying to destroy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries, because I was far more zealous for the traditions of my ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when God, who set me apart before I was born and who called me by his grace, was pleased
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to reveal his Son to me so that I might proclaim him among the gentiles, I did not confer with another human being at any time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to see those who were apostles before me. Instead, I went away to Arabia and then came back to Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then three years later, I went up to Jerusalem to become acquainted with Cephas, and I stayed with him for fifteen days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I did not see any other apostle except James, the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Before God, what I’m writing to you is the truth.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went to the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the churches of the Messiah that are in Judea did not yet know me personally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The only thing they kept hearing was this: “The man who used to persecute us is now proclaiming the faith he once tried to destroy!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they kept glorifying God for what had happened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fourteen years later, I again went up to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went in response to a revelation, and in a private meeting with the reputed leaders, I explained to them the gospel that I’m proclaiming to the gentiles. I did this because I was afraid that I was running or had run my life’s race for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not even Titus, who was with me, was forced to be circumcised, even though he was a Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, false brothers were secretly brought in. They slipped in to spy on the freedom we have in the Messiah Jesus so that they might enslave us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we did not give in to them for a moment, so that the truth of the gospel might always remain with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who were reputed to be important added nothing to my message. (What sort of people they were makes no difference to me, since God pays no attention to outward appearances.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcised, just as Peter had been entrusted with the gospel for the circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who worked through Peter by making him an apostle to the circumcised also worked through me by sending me to the gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when James, Cephas, and John (who were reputed to be leaders) recognized the grace that had been given me, they gave Barnabas and me the right hand of fellowship, agreeing that we should go to the gentiles and they to the circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The only thing they asked us to do was to remember the destitute, the very thing I was eager to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he was clearly wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until some men arrived from James, he was in the habit of eating with the gentiles, but after those men came, he withdrew from the gentiles and would not associate with them any longer, because he was afraid of the circumcision party.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other Jews also joined him in this hypocritical behavior, to the extent that even Barnabas was caught up in their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw that they were not acting consistently with the truth of the gospel, I told Cephas in front of everyone, “Though you are a Jew, you have been living like a gentile and not like a Jew. So how can you insist that the gentiles must live like Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ourselves are Jews by birth, and not gentile sinners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet we know that a person is not justified by doing what the Law requires, but rather by the faithfulness of Jesus the Messiah. We, too, have believed in the Messiah Jesus so that we might be justified by the faithfulness of the Messiah and not by doing what the Law requires, for no human being will be justified by doing what the Law requires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if we, while trying to be justified by the Messiah, have been found to be sinners, does that mean that the Messiah is serving the interests of sin? Of course not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I rebuild something that I tore down, I demonstrate that I am a wrongdoer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the Law I died to the Law so that I might live for God. I have been crucified with the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I no longer live, but the Messiah lives in me, and the life that I am now living in this body I live by the faithfulness of the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not misapply God’s grace, for if righteousness comes about by doing what the Law requires, then the Messiah died for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You foolish Galatians! Who put you under a spell? Was not Jesus the Messiah clearly portrayed before your very eyes as having been crucified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want to learn only one thing from you: Did you receive the Spirit by doing the actions of the Law or by believing what you heard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you so foolish? Having started out with the Spirit, are you now ending up with the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did you suffer so much for nothing? (If it really was for nothing!)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does God supply you with the Spirit and work miracles among you because you do the actions of the Law or because you believe what you heard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, Abraham “believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see, then, that those who have faith are Abraham’s real descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Scripture saw ahead of time that God would justify the gentiles by faith, it announced the gospel to Abraham beforehand when it said, “Through you all nations will be blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, those who believe are blessed together with Abraham, the one who believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly all who depend on the actions of the Law are under a curse. For it is written, “A curse on everyone who does not obey everything that is written in the Book of the Law!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is obvious that no one is justified in the sight of God by the Law, because “The righteous will live by faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Law has nothing to do with faith. Instead, “The person who keeps the commandments will have life in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Messiah redeemed us from the curse of the Law by becoming a curse for us. For it is written, “A curse on everyone who is hung on a tree!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened in order that the blessing promised to Abraham would come to the gentiles through the Messiah Jesus, so that we might receive the promised Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, let me use an example from everyday life. Once an agreement has been ratified, no one can cancel it or add conditions to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his descendant. It doesn’t say “descendants,” referring to many, but “your descendant,” referring to one person, who is the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I mean: The Law that came 430 years later did not cancel the covenant that God ratified previously. The promise was never nullified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance comes about through the Law, it no longer comes about through the promise. But it was through a promise that God so graciously gave it to Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why, then, was the Law added? Because of transgressions, until the descendant came to whom the promise pertained. It was put into effect through angels by means of a mediator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a mediator involves more than one party, but God is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is the Law in conflict with the promises of God? Of course not! For if a law had been given that could give us life, then certainly righteousness would come through the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Scripture has captured everything by means of sin’s net, so that what was promised by the faithfulness of the Messiah might be granted to those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before faith came about, we were held in custody and confined under the Law in preparation for the faith that was to be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so the Law was our guardian until the Messiah came, so that we might be justified by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that faith has come about, we are no longer under a guardian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all of you are God’s children through faith in the Messiah Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, all of you who were baptized into the Messiah have clothed yourselves with the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because all of you are one in the Messiah Jesus, a person is no longer a Jew or a Greek, a slave or a free person, a male or a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you belong to the Messiah, then you are Abraham’s descendants indeed, and heirs according to the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now what I am saying is this: As long as an heir is a child, he is no better off than a slave, even though he owns everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, he is placed under the care of guardians and servant managers until the time set by the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the same way with us. While we were children, we were slaves to the basic principles of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the appropriate time had come, God sent his Son, born by a woman, born under the Law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to redeem those who were under the Law, and thus to adopt them as his children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now because you are his children, God has sent the Spirit of his Son into our hearts to cry out, “Abba! Father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are no longer a slave but a child, and if you are a child, then you are also an heir because of what God did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, in the past, when you did not know God, you were slaves to things that are not really gods at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that you know God, or rather have been known by God, how can you turn back again to those powerless and bankrupt basic principles? Why do you want to become their slaves all over again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are observing days, months, seasons, and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid for you! I don’t want my work for you to have been wasted!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I beg you, brothers, to become like me, since I became like you. You did not do anything wrong to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that it was because I was ill that I brought you the gospel the first time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though my condition put you to the test, you did not despise or reject me. On the contrary, you welcomed me as if I were an angel of God, or as if I were the Messiah Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What, then, happened to your positive attitude? For I testify that if it had been possible, you would have torn out your eyes and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So have I now become your enemy for telling you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people who have been instructing you are devoted to you, but not in a good way. They want you to avoid me so that you will be devoted to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it is always good to be devoted to a good cause, even when I am not with you.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My children, I am suffering birth pains for you again until the Messiah is formed in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I wish I were with you right now so that I could change the tone of my voice, because I am completely baffled by you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, those of you who want to live under the Law: Are you really listening to what the Law says?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by a slave woman and the other by a free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the slave woman’s son was conceived through human means, while the free woman’s son was conceived through divine promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is being said as an allegory, for these women represent two covenants. The one woman, Hagar, is from Mount Sinai, and her children are born into slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia and corresponds to present-day Jerusalem, because she is in slavery along with her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the heavenly Jerusalem is the free woman, and she is our spiritual mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written,
“Rejoice, you childless woman,
    who cannot give birth to any children!
Break into song and shout,
    you who feel no pains of childbirth!
For the children of the deserted woman
    are more numerous than the children
        of the woman who has a husband.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you, brothers, are children of the promise, like Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But just as then the son who was conceived according to the flesh persecuted the son who was conceived according to the Spirit, so it is now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what does the Scripture say? “Drive out the slave woman and her son, for the son of the slave woman must never share the inheritance with the son of the free woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brothers, we are not children of the slave woman but of the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Messiah has set us free so that we may enjoy the benefits of freedom. So keep on standing firm in it, and stop putting yourselves under the yoke of slavery again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! I, Paul, am telling you that if you allow yourselves to be circumcised, the Messiah will be of no benefit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, I insist that everyone who allows himself to be circumcised is obligated to obey the entire Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those of you who are trying to be justified by the Law have been cut off from the Messiah. You have fallen away from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through the Spirit by faith we confidently await the fulfillment of our righteous hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in union with the Messiah Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision matters. What matters is faith expressed through love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were running the race beautifully. Who cut in on you and stopped you from obeying the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such influence does not come from the one who calls you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little yeast spreads through the whole batch of dough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am confident in the Lord that you will take no other view of this. However, the one who is troubling you will suffer God’s judgment, whoever he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, brothers, if I am still preaching the necessity of circumcision, why am I still being persecuted? In that case the offense of the cross has been removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish that those who are upsetting you would castrate themselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, brothers, were called to freedom. Only do not turn your freedom into an opportunity to gratify your flesh, but through love make it your habit to serve one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the whole Law is summarized in a single statement: “You must love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you bite and devour one another, be careful that you are not destroyed by each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I say, live by the Spirit, and you will never fulfill the desires of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what the flesh wants is opposed to the Spirit, and what the Spirit wants is opposed to the flesh. They are opposed to each other, and so you do not do what you want to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are being led by the Spirit, you are not under the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the actions of the flesh are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity, promiscuity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, rivalry, jealously, outbursts of anger, quarrels, conflicts, factions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: envy, murder, drunkenness, wild partying, and things like that. I am telling you now, as I have told you in the past, that people who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: gentleness, and self-control. There is no law against such things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who belong to the Messiah Jesus have crucified their flesh with its passions and desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we live by the Spirit, by the Spirit let us also be guided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let’s stop being arrogant, provoking one another and envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, if a person is caught doing something wrong, those of you who are spiritual should restore that person gently. Watch out for yourself so that you are not tempted as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Practice carrying each other’s burdens. In this way you will fulfill the law of the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if anyone thinks he is something when he is really nothing, he is only fooling himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each person must examine his own actions, and then he can boast about his own accomplishments and not about someone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone must carry his own load.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who is taught the word should share all his goods with his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stop being deceived; God is not to be ridiculed. A person harvests whatever he plants:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who sows through human means will harvest decay from human means, but the person who sows in the Spirit will harvest eternal life from the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let’s not get tired of doing what is good, for at the right time we will reap a harvest—if we do not give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, whenever we have the opportunity, let’s practice doing good to everyone, especially to the family of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at how large these letters are because I am writing with my own hand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people who want to impress others by their external appearance are trying to force you to be circumcised, simply to avoid being persecuted for the cross of the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why, not even those who are circumcised obey the Law! They simply want you to be circumcised so that they can boast about your external appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But may I never boast about anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, by which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision matters. Rather, what matters is being a new creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may peace be on all those who live by this principle, and may mercy be on the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one make any more trouble for me, because I carry the scars of Jesus on my own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be with your spirit, brothers! Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
